title: Is BBA LLB better than just doing BBA? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi If you want to pursue your career in law after your 12th then you must go for integrated BBA LLB hons. and if you are interested in management then you should go for BBA and then you can go for masters of Business management- MBA. BBA + LL.b Hons. : Graduates may opt for legal practice, where management foundation will groom aspiring lawyers for the corporate sector. BBA is a Bachelor of Business Administration. This degree offers an optimum blend of theory and practice to provides a solid foundation in general business management with specializations in area of choice. In BBA students are exposed to various fields like: marketing, accounting and finance, HRM, banking and insurance There are a number of combinations available for you such as: BBA 3 years. , Dual Degree BBA - MBA 5 years., BBA (Hons.) 3 years., Dual Degree BBA (Hons.) - MBA, 5 years. , BBA (Information Technology) 3 years. , BBA (Financial Markets) 3 years. , BBA (International Finance) 3 years. , BBA (Oil and Gas Management) 3 years. , Integrated BBA - MBA 4 years. These above mentioned are the courses which you can opt according to your area of interest. It is always advisable to go for the top universities while choosing the university for pursuing your education. For BBA + LL.b Hons. you can go for: Modi Law College-Laxmangarh, Rajasthan, Lovely Professional University- Punjab, Navrachna University-Baroda, Christ University, School of Law, Gujarat University-Ahmedabad, South Calcutta Law College - Kolkata, Unitedworld School of Law, Karnavati University-Gandhinagar, For BBA you can go for: Ramjas College - Delhi, Lovely Professional University- Punjab, Kristu Jayanti College - Bangalore, Christ University, Madras Christian College(MCC) - Chennai, J D Birla Institute - Kolkata, Goenka College of Commerce and Business Administration - Kolkata. I hope it helps.

Law is a very lucrative career option.However BBA Degree does not hold much value in current market conditions. I will advise you to opt for B.A. LLB since Law is basically concerned with humanities & opting for the same will give you added advantage in government examinations. Moreover you will not be at any kind of disadvantage during placements .By completing B.A. LLB there are ample career opportunities which you can opt for . Some of them are :- Civil Services / State P.C.SJunior Division Civil JudgeLegal Advisor in Public Sector UndertakingPartner in a Law FirmLitigationLegal Processing Outsourcing7.Legal Journalist / Legal Reporter 8. Pursuing MBA after completing your LLB will significantly improve your career opportunities.
